us.fihgu.toolbox.item

Interface ModelInjector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CustomTexturedArmor, CustomTexturedBow, CustomTexturedItem, CustomTexturedLeatherArmor, CustomTexturedTool

    public interface ModelInjector
    Can be implemented by a CustomItem or a class that extends the CustomItem. Otherwise, it will not be able to inject the textures, unless the inject(ItemModel, File) is overriden with your own code.

    This interface will allow you to define your own model for your custom item.
    Created by fihgu, improved by chrismin13.

    Author:
    fihgu
    See Also:
    CustomTexturedItem

    • Method Detail

      • getOverrideEntries

        java.util.HashMap<ModelInjection,java.lang.Short> getOverrideEntries()

        Provide your override entry to define the model that you want to use.
        The "damaged" and "damage" tag will be automatically defined by the toolbox, you don't need to worry about them.

        Note: You should at least provide an entry with a empty predicate tag that points to your basic model

        Returns:
        A list of override entries that need to be injected into the base model.

        -- The base model is the original item's model, we inject a override entry so it will display the model we defined when an itemstack matches our custom item id.

      • getAllTextures

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Short> getAllTextures()
        This is needed for later use and will be filled with Texture Names when using addTexture(String) and with the appropriate durability values when the API is enabled. Here's some example code:
        private Map overrideModels = new HashMap(); @Override public Map getAllTextures() { return overrideModels; }

      • addTexture

        default void addTexture(java.lang.String texture)
        Add a Texture Name that will be included with the Textured Item.
        Parameters:
        texture - The Texture Name.

      • getTexture

        default java.lang.String getTexture(short durability)
        This is only valid after the API has been enabled. Otherwise, it will be null.
        Get the Texture Name that is assigned to the Durability Value that you define.
        Parameters:
        durability - The durability Value.
        Returns:
        The Texture Name.

      • getDefaultTexture

        java.lang.String getDefaultTexture()
        Returns:
        The Default Texture that the Textured Item will have. This must be defined upon creating the Java Object and never be changed during the Object's lifetime.

      • checkCustomItem

        default void checkCustomItem()
        Check if this instancce of ModelInjector is a CustomItem.

      • inject

        default void inject(ItemModel baseModel,
                    java.io.File workspace)
        Inject the override entries into the base model.
        Also put custom models into work space.

      • getDamageableItem

        default DamageableItem getDamageableItem()
        Get the DamageableItem of the CustomTexturedItem. This value cannot be changed.
        Returns:
        DamageableItem
